title: Suspension Electronic Control Module (ECM) - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the front and rear suspension stroke sensors must be calibrated.
Incorrect calibration of the front and rear suspension stroke sensors may cause an unsafe riding condition resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the rear preload motor will calibrate automatically after turning the ignition switch ON.
If the rear suspension unit has been removed/refitted, the Triumph Diagnostic Tool must be used to calibrate the rear preload motor.
Connect the suspension ECM electrical connector (see
Suspension ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
) and the ECM to the rear mudguard.
Connect the storage box USB connector to the main harness.
Fit the storage box locating pins to the rear mudguard. Fit the two scrivets to secure the storage box.
If a new suspension ECM has been fitted, calibrate the front and rear suspension stroke sensors (See
Front and Rear Suspension Stroke Sensor Calibration
If the rear suspension unit has been removed/refitted, calibrate the rear preload motor (See
Rear Suspension Unit Preload Motor Calibration
